meanings.definition: To install or connect (a device or system) by means of hardwires.
meanings.sent1: Dad hardwires the new computer to the internet for faster connection.
meanings.sent2: The electrician hardwires the security cameras to the main control panel.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly hardwires its circuits to the wrong ports, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work hardwires her to always strive for excellence.
meanings.sent5: The old house still hardwires its lighting system to the original switches.

meanings.definition: To make (a quality or behavior) a permanent part of someone's nature or character.
meanings.sent1: Regular practice hardwires the skill of playing the piano into her abilities.
meanings.sent2: Positive affirmations can hardwire a mindset of optimism and resilience.
meanings.sent3: His love for chocolate hardwires him to always choose it over other desserts.
meanings.sent4: The traumatic experience hardwires a sense of caution into her decision-making.
meanings.sent5: Growing up in a diverse community hardwires an appreciation for different cultures.
